attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to use lies as part of a campaign for a public vote
attributes.background: The use of lies in public campaigns is  growing

attributes.action: Expand the Ancestry Visa to Commonwealth Citizens w/ UK born great grandparents
attributes.background: Currently, the Home Office only allows for Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born grandparent to obtain an ancestry visa. We want to change this and extend this visa to Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born great-grandparent.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have cousins spread across the Commonwealth who still maintain close family connections with us despite the fact that they have been out of the UK for a few generations. If they wish to return to our island, then we should allow them to do so. In addition most of them have a great understanding of our political system and culture, as well conform to our standards. An act such as this will put us in a better position with the Commonwealth and help fill the Brexit labour shortage.

attributes.action: Stop giving taxpayers' money to the National Union of Students (NUS).
attributes.background:
NUS is a political organisation not a union and thus must not be given taxpayers money. 
 
http://mallarduk.com/as-a-student-the-nus-continues-to-embarrass-me%E2%94%82-matt-gillow

attributes.action: Repeal Section 127 (1) of the 2003 Communications Act. Offence is not a crime.
attributes.background:
The Communications Act states: (1) A person is guilty of an offence if he 
(a) sends by means of a public electronic communications network a message or other matter that is GROSSLY OFFENSIVE or of an indecent, obscene or menacing character.
attributes.additional_details: Clearly, this is in breach of everybody's right to Freedom of Speech. Offence is an entirely subjective concept. For the state to be able to decide what is offensive, and then prosecute accordingly is tyrannical.

attributes.action: Automatic British Citizenship for Indefinite Leave to Remainers settled 15 years
attributes.background: My parents immigrated to the UK with my sister and I in 1988. I obtained ILR status in 2001 having lived in the U.K. since aged 2, gone to university and worked here all my life. It’s not fair to have to sit a test and pay £1330 to become Naturalised. Britain has been my home all my life.
attributes.additional_details: I am 31 years old. I have lived in the U.K. for 29 years.  I have had ILR status since 2001 (for 17 years). It is not fair to have to sit a life in the UK test and pay £1330 to become naturalised. I’ve gone to nursery, primary school, secondary school and  University and spent my whole working life in the U.K. The Government even recognise my 9 month old daughter as British so why do I have to pay over the odds when I pay tax and national insurance and have done my whole working life!

attributes.action: Provide free legal aid for those on low incomes and benefits
attributes.background: Some of the poorest families in England and Wales are being denied legal aid because they cannot afford the financial contributions they are required to make, This is a travesty and totally unfair sign this petition to give justice to the poorest in our society. Give them free access to lawyers.
attributes.additional_details:
A study commissioned by the body that represents solicitors criticised the fact that many on low incomes are being deprived of access to justice by the very system that is supposed to support them.

The report, titled Priced out of Justice?, looked at means testing regulations which control  and how applicants resisting eviction from their homes, for example, are unable to obtain legal representation.

How can this be happening in a modern day democracy. Its reminiscent of the 18th and 19th C

attributes.action: Require all toll bridges to treat disabled people equally
attributes.background: The Government must require parity for all disabled people to use toll bridges and roads for free, not just those on Disability Living Allowance. For example, I’m disabled but too old to qualify for disability living allowance which means I can’t use the Dartford river crossing for free.
attributes.additional_details: As a blue badge holder I can go through London without paying the congestion charge surely it should be the same using the Dartford river crossing. This is free for people who receive Disability Living Allowance and has an exemption from paying vehicle tax as a result. However anyone in my position is still required to pay due to being too old to apply for Disability Living Allowance.

attributes.action: Ban the use of high-frequency sonic deterrents against young people
attributes.background:
'Mosquitos' are devices deployed outside shops in public areas, with the aim of deterring loitering. They output high-energy 17400Hz waves, only heard by children and young adults.

This 108-decibel assault is painful, causes headaches, and discriminates against all young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Mosquito use infringes on section 14 (discrimination) of the European Convention on Human Rights and the Human Rights Act 1998. The Council of Europe has recommended in 2010 that it be banned.

Mosquito emissions are irritating, painful, and have been compared to forms of torture.

Kent County Council have already banned these on council-owned buildings - why are the Government not at least doing the same?

attributes.action: No military action in Syria until perpetrators of chemical attacks are verified.
attributes.background: Involvement in missile strikes or other military action against the Syrian government will escalate the conflict, resulting in yet greater loss of life. Please hold back until we know more.

attributes.action: Write all laws in Plain English
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that in order for the majority of the people to fully participate in the governance of the country, our laws should be written in a language that the people can readily understand.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that the current practice of drafting and presenting laws in Legal English and “Legalese” is detrimental to a truly representative Parliament and the involvement of the people in the government of the country.

We therefore demand that all future laws made in the UK Parliament should be written in Plain English.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of peanut products in cinemas
attributes.background: Going to the cinema can be a traumatic time for many people with a peanut/nut allergy. Spending most of the time looking around to make sure that someone next to you is not about to open a packet of Peanut M&M’s or another product containing peanuts. Families should feel safe in a place of enjoyment
attributes.additional_details:
Peanut allergies affect 1 in 55 children in the UK, why put our children at risk in a place that is suppose to be enjoyable? 
 Every cinema I have visited in the UK so far sells Peanut M&M’s as a film-time snack. Are there not enough other snacks available without the need to sell peanut based products?? 
 Nuts are in the top 3 most common food allergies in the UK to date, and with this allergy being also airborne this causes more of a danger in close public spaces such as cinemas.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for motorbikes to have different coloured headlamps to cars
attributes.background: Driving at night, in heavy traffic or in wet weather it is often difficult to differentiate a motorbike weaving down between lanes from other cars.  If motorbikes had a different coloured headlamp (yellow maybe), drivers, incl. other riders, looking in rear/side view mirrors would better spot them.
attributes.additional_details: I think this would significantly improve road safety by reducing the number of car accidents with motorbikes when they are not seen by drivers joining / changing lanes in heavy traffic.  The headlight colour would obviously need to be one that would afford the bike rider equal visibility.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.

attributes.action: All EU powers should return to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit
attributes.background: The UK government is saying that they need to reserve some powers after Brexit to protect the UK single market.  But that’s not necessarily true.  What they’re proposing would actually damage the UK and the UK single market.  So I call on the UK to automatically devolve all of these EU powers.
attributes.additional_details: Devolving all these powers would might prevent the break up of the UK.  Whereas, what the UK government is proposing would actually break Britain up.  So I would like to see a cross-party discussion on this.

attributes.action: Introduce new regulations for the development of Artificial Intelligence.
attributes.background: Artificial Intelligence is intelligent behaviour, exhibited by computers. Currently AI is at a primitive stage, home assistants are starting to play a role in our lives, but what they can do for us is limited. I want to see new regulations, for further development of AI and Machine Learning.
attributes.additional_details:
Many experts, including founder of Microsoft, Bill Gates, and Professor Stephen Hawking, have raised concerns over the development of AI. Many in particular believe that, by 2045, the point of Technological Singularity will occur. This means that, if AI is developed, without regulation, it could surpass human intelligence.

AI is useful at the present time, however, continuing to develop this, without limits, is dangerous. Machines will always make mistakes, let's not become inferior to them.

attributes.action: Ban positive action in organisations and have all candidates treated equally.
attributes.background: Positive action is unfair. For example, a wealthy female will have an advantage over a less affluent male when it comes to recruitment. No organisation should ask for race, religion, gender or sexuality. This is not relevant to the job and results in less effective recruitment UK wide.
attributes.additional_details: Companies and government organisations should be concerned with finding the best, regardless of non-relevant issues such as a persons sexuality. Employers should be blind when it comes to who gets through to assessment centres and interviews. It’s not fair that suddenly every white male is considered as having being born with a silver spoon. It’s also not fair to treat minorities and women as though they need an advantage in the recruitment process as they couldn’t get the job on their merit

attributes.action: Ban nudity on social media
attributes.background: Nudity has a negative affect on society, and vulnerable individuals are pressured into posting provocative images online which will stay there forever. Naked pictures online causes harm to future generations, because children may feel ‘not good enough’ when compared to the images online.
attributes.additional_details: Instagram and YouTube are full of inappropriate material that shouldn’t be uploaded in the first place.

attributes.action: Teach young adults the struggles of owning a house.
attributes.background: I would like for schools and colleges ect, to teach young adults how hard it is to run a property of their own so when it comes to them having their own property rented, bought or shared accommodation they will know what to do when they come to the hurdles without it ending in them becoming homeless
attributes.additional_details: I strongly agree something like this should be taught budgeting, mortgages. Too many people going into the world with no life skills.

attributes.action: Law requiring food chains to show the calories on menus.
attributes.background:
All food-service chains with 20 or more locations must post the number of calories in the food and drink items they sell.
This law should be implemented as it allows the public to count the amount of calories they eat. It can also reduce the chances of obesity.

attributes.action: Ban all advertising boards on the side of motorways.
attributes.background: Drivers are constantly being threatened with prosecution if they use mobile phones, smoke, vape or do anything that distracts them from driving. Motorway advertising is specifically designed to distract drivers. Some of them have animation and can be very bright by using neon type lighting.
attributes.additional_details: It is a central argument of the government that distractions such as mobile phones etc can affect the driving ability of road users. The same evidence and research can be used to argue that advertising boards have the same effect and are therefore dangerous.

attributes.action: Full-time employees to receive £100 bonus a month if they have no sickness
attributes.background: People who work full time, pay bills, have no help and have little left per month should be rewarded with a £100 incentive. This would make people working full time feel appreciated. The Government are helping the wrong people and its time for full-time workers to have a reward.

attributes.action: Adopt unilateral free trade with the whole world.
attributes.background: We call upon the Government to adopt Unilateral Free Trade to reduce import costs to consumers and businesses. This means removing all tariffs on goods and services, reducing non-tariff trade barriers and recognising other countries' technical standards as equivalent unilaterally.
attributes.additional_details:
Unilateral free trade is the most pragmatic and fair trade policy for Britain. End discriminatory, mercantilist policies and embrace UFT to (1) lower input costs for businesses and the poorest consumers; (2) allow negotiators to focus on services agreements; (3) stimulate domestic competition; (4) reduce red-tape; and (6) lead by example to make the moral case for free trade. 

If you are unwilling to show leadership on trade issues, Britain's consumers are more than willing to do so.

attributes.action: Make all school "Keep Clear" markings mandatory zones instead of advisory.
attributes.background: Too many people ignore the Keep Clear markings around school entrances as currently they are advisory unless accompanied by signage and enforced by the local Councils. Making them compulsory No Parking zones would make school entrances safer for all.

attributes.action: Change the British military's standard issue rifle to the C8/L119
attributes.background: The British military's current rifle, the SA80/L85, is completely outclassed by the Colt Canada C8SFW Carbine, with its higher stopping power and rate of fire, already in use by special forces, the Royal Military Police and Royal Marine 43 Commando Fleet Protection Group
attributes.additional_details: Already a proven rifle, the swap would increase the effectiveness of a single infantry soldier in a firefight. The similarities to the US M4 would also allow spare parts to be used between us and our most powerful ally, and allow soldiers to pick up each other's weapons, for whatever reason, and already be used to an extremely similar one.

attributes.action: British Citizens must be subject to UK taxation wherever they live in the world
attributes.background: The current system encourages high-earning individuals to leave the UK for tax purposes. This is not in the national interest.

attributes.action: Make it so any employer has to reply to job applications within a month.
attributes.background: Applying for a job and getting no reply is demoralising and can leave you unmotivated to apply for others. If you get no reply, you’re unsure if your CV is bad or if they’re ignoring your application. Therefore, employers should reply to applications within a certain amount of time.
attributes.additional_details: If you’re told that you’re not accepted, then it will help significantly more than being told nothing, as you can then build on your CV / application technique. But when you’re ignored, then you don’t know what is wrong and when it happens with every job you apply for it can seriously damage motivation to apply for more. Therefore I feel it is a right that an applicant reserves; to get a reply - wether it be a yes or no or simply that the role is now fulfilled.

attributes.action: Ban social media that doesnt confirm your age officially or allows you anonymity
attributes.background: Social media is far too often used as a barrier to hide behind and bully others. Snapchat, Facebook, Sarahah, need to start confirming children's ages with official documents and stop allowing users to remain anonymous. Bullying can kill and it must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public toilets to have better personal hygiene facilities
attributes.background: Everyday hundred of thousands of Britons use public bathrooms and there is only ever tissue! How can anyone clean them selves properly with just tissue. This also means that hundereds of thousand of Britons are walking around with with feces (harmful bacteria) on their bodies. It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details: more suitable cleaning apparatus EG: a Bidet shower

attributes.action: Lower wait time for new universal credit claims
attributes.background: The current wait time for new universal credit claims is 5 weeks. This means low income families go without money for that period and puts families in severe hardship. Tax credit claims by contrast only take 3 weeks. We need to speed this up to save families from making difficult decisions.

attributes.action: Increase funding and awareness for public transport in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is well known for being a modern and developed nation, but do we really do all that we can to make our country green? We are falling behind compared to many other countries. This directly affects everyone in the UK so take our country's future into your hands; sign now to have your say.

attributes.action: ILR easier to get for spouse of British citizen married 5 years+ wt British kids
attributes.background: British citizens who marry non citizens have the right to live with their spouses in the UK especially when it is obvious that their marriage is sincere with British children together. Please stop separating families.  The criteria to qualify for Indefinite Leave to Remain is too strict.
attributes.additional_details: Couples who marry within or outside the UK and have been married for over 5 years are obviously sincere. Having children together makes them more sincere. A desire to work and not access public funds makes them value added to British society. Please encourage families to stay together and live happily in the UK. Please stop encouraging mothers to be single and creating dysfunctional children due to absent fathers. UK is the UNITED KINGDOM not DIVIDED KINGDOM. Keep love and unity as the motto.

attributes.action: pay state pensions into pensioners bank accounts on the day they are due
attributes.background: if your state pension is due on say the 15th it should be in the pensinors account on the 15th  not up to 15 days later
attributes.additional_details: my state pension is allways received 5-10 days late and the pension centre say this is normal?

attributes.action: Restore expatriate Pensioners in Spain their Winter Fuel Allowance.
attributes.background: Expat Pensioners have paid into the system and require parity with Pensioners in the UK. If it is right for UK residents it must be right for Spanish expatriates to receive their allowance.
attributes.additional_details: When the temperatures drop in winter, as they do in the UK, pensioners in Spain need to burn wood to keep their homes warm - homes that have been designed to remain cold in summer become very cold in winter. A great many pensioners are not wealthy but just about surviving on their meagre pension income. The seasonal temperature variation can be as much as 50 + centrigade with the temperatures falling below 0 degrees centigrade when the Sun sets in the Winter season.

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure all future England football matches are 'free to air'
attributes.background:
The excitement, drama, joy & pain of being an England supporter has been made so evident to a new generation. 

We should encourage those fans to hold their interest in the wonderful game and allow TV licence paid access for all of them and us diehards too. 

No satellite/cable//other fee needed
attributes.additional_details:
Euro 2020 Final is at Wembley on 12th July 2020.

Let us be there all the way.

It's coming home!

This wiki about OfCom, the Broadcasting Act 1996 & subsequent Regulations shows only that only the finals for Euro 2020 are covered and that all other qualifying matches/friendlies will be pay per view or subscription. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ofcom_Code_on_Sports_and_Other_Listed_and_Designated_Events

attributes.action: Abolish business rates in favour of sales tax to rejuvenate town centres.
attributes.background: Town centres are dying because of crippling business rates so a sales tax makes sense to reduce burdens on start up businesses.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for under 25's so it is equal and fair for all
attributes.background: For people who are aged 25 and over the minimum wage is £7.83 in 2018 yet if you are below the age of 25, even if just by one year, then you are entitled to less. The younger you are the less money you get. Same job, same hours but someone is going to be paid less based on their age.
attributes.additional_details: As said previously a person aged 25 and over will be paid £7.83p/h, a 21 to 24 year old will be paid £7.38 an hour. If aged between 18 and 20 you will receive £5.90p/h and finally, if you are a school leaver or in college under the age of 18 you will only recieve £4.20. The cost of living does not depend on your age so why should your wages? This is a form of discrimination which needs to change so everyone can have a good start in life but a majority of companies play by these guidelines.

attributes.action: Set a government cap on the price of Fuel
attributes.background: The price of Petrol is getting ridiculous and has gone up everyday for months, it should be capped at £1.00 a litre.

attributes.action: Abolish International Student Fees and Finance Ineligibility for UK Citizens
attributes.background: The prerequisite three year residence in the UK deprives British citizens from the ability to access Student Finance, meaning that families have to attempt to pay the massive fees on their own. This disadvantages domestic students, and is unfair on those who possess British passports and citizenship
attributes.additional_details: I moved back to the UK from overseas in June 2017, and wish to apply for university in 2019, once I have completed A Levels. I was born in Kings-Lynn, Norfolk, and have possessed a British passport all my life. Having never lived under another nationality, or been a permanent resident of any foreign country, to find out that I am classed as an international student within my own borders is upsetting, and is a disadvantage for me, as I now cannot afford higher education, or find myself a job.

attributes.action: Raise the stamp duty on second homes and onwards to 50% to fund home building.
attributes.background: House prices are too high for first time buyers. Funds raised by stamp duty on second homes can be used to build new affordable homes.

attributes.action: Ban Smacking In England
attributes.background: Smacking isn’t needed and many times it has been proven by specialists that smacking isn’t needed to correct bad behavior. It’s time to ban it and humanely educate our kids to behave without hitting them.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to rejoin the EU before June 30th 2019
attributes.background: UK voted to leave the EU and has the chance to view what life outside the EU is like post 29th March 2019. If it is good then we can vote to stay outside the EU, if not we can vote to apply to rejoin as a full member of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: There is much debate about the possible negative effect of leaving the EU in March 2019. The UK will know shortly afterwards what the real effect has been and should be given the chance to rejoin again if there has been damage caused which will become worse the longer it continues, hence the referendum must take place within 3 months of leaving.

attributes.action: Include awareness of emotional and physical abuse to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We're at a time in our lives and our society where abuse, emotional or physical, is being seen as normal. Children as young as even 10 or some younger are not able to recognise normal behaviour anymore and see abuse of any kind as normal. This needs to stop now, any age it's not acceptable.

attributes.action: Give all carers with SGO the same allowance regardless of income
attributes.background:
Carers with SGOs keep children out of the care system.  Some of us get an allowance, others don't.  
We get deductions from these allowances, yet we do the same as foster carers who get larger allowances. 
We have the additional issues of emotional attatchement to these children.
attributes.additional_details:
We care for children who have a lot of emotional issues,  we keep them out of the care system because we have a heart and love these children as if they were our own. Yet we get penalised for this, some SGO carers get no help bringing these children up and giving them the life every child deserves.
The government should not make deductions to allowances and should make the allowance the same for every carer regardless of income.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking on streets
attributes.background: Smoking on the streets is bad for other people through passive smoking and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It was proven that when the indoor smoking ban was brought into force over 700,000 people stopped smoking

attributes.action: Do not ban 'cartoon characters' from 'unhealthy foods'.
attributes.background: MPs on the Health Committee wish to ban cartoon characters on 'unhealthy food' (such as Tony the Tiger & Nestle's Milky Bar Kid). These brand mascots have been around for decades yet obesity rates are only very high now due to bad parenting.
attributes.additional_details: Link to BBC Article - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44298135

attributes.action: Add "None of the above" to the election ballot paper.
attributes.background: With belief in MP's of all parties at an all time low, add "None of the above" to the ballot paper to remove all candidates in a constituency from standing in elections for 10 years. this may make candidates, MP's and parties more respectful and responsive to the electorate in their constituencies.
attributes.additional_details: If "None of the above" wins the ballot then all those candidate on the ballot paper would be barred from standing for office for 10 years

attributes.action: UK residents aged 16 and 17 year olds should be able to vote in referendums.
attributes.background: I think that people in the UK who were 16/17 should be able to vote in referendums. An example of this I think that 16/17 should have been able to vote in the EU referendum and weren't allowed to and leaving the EU will affect those who weren't able to vote in it, me being one of those individuals.

attributes.action: Make Government Funds Available for Victims & Families of Terrorist Attacks
attributes.background:
I was shocked to recently learn that there is ‘No’ financial funding help for victims or their families of terrorist attacks in the U.K. 
In light of the Manchester Arena bombing, and the 22 victims, London Bridge Attack, Westminster Attack, Finsbury Park Attack in 2017 we should be helping.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Funds need to be made available for victims and their families , and those who have been affected by incidents of terrorism in the United Kingdom. There needs to be a special fund set up to help these people, and their families who need to take time off work, to look after family members, general living expenses, and specialist care.
This is the least we can do as a nation, to help people who need it the most. After experiencing such life affecting atrocities!

attributes.action: Revert the Design & Technology Resistant Materials GCSE to its prior curriculum
attributes.background:
I signed up to make stuff
Now I am learning about cotton
I did not sign up for this

attributes.action: Offer all GCSE, A level and University students a mental health check
attributes.background: Lots of young adults have mental health issues and don't speak out about it and are scared to. To stop this from developing all students should have a mental health check yearly between years 10 to finishing university. This can then get all students the help that they deserve and should have.
attributes.additional_details: School is hard enough to get through and deal with during these stressful times without having disorders and everything holding you down. This can become easier through knowing who has these issues and helping them through the process.
